text:
Begin by finding a comfortable seat. This could be on a chair, on the floor, or anywhere where you can sit with a straight back. Close your eyes gently. Take a deep breath in... and a long breath out. <PAUSE: 5>

Notice your body in space. The contact of your feet with the floor. The feel of the chair beneath you. Notice any sensations or tensions... just notice, without trying to change anything. <PAUSE: 10> 

Take another deep breath in... hold it for a moment... and exhale, letting all the tension in your body melt away. <PAUSE: 10> 

Now bring your attention to your breath. The coolness of the air as you breathe in, the warmth as you breathe out. How it feels as it flows in and out of your nostrils, or the rise and fall of your chest or stomach. Let your breath find its own natural rhythm. Try to observe it without altering it. <PAUSE: 15>

As you focus on your breath, you may notice your mind start to wander. This is perfectly normal. Just acknowledge whatever it is that has caught your attention, and then gently bring your focus back to your breath. <PAUSE: 15>

You are not trying to achieve anything in these few moments. Just observe your breath, your body, your thoughts without judgment. You're simply giving your mind a break from the hustle and bustle of daily life. <PAUSE: 10>

Become aware of your heart center, maybe even place a hand there. Feel it rise and fall with your breath. And as you exhale, imagine a sense of peace and calm flowing through you. <PAUSE: 15>

Take a final deep breath in… and out. Start to bring your attention back to your surroundings. The sounds around you, the sensations of your body against your chair or on the floor. Wiggle your fingers, wiggle your toes, and open your eyes slowly when you're ready. <PAUSE: 15>

Know that you can bring this sense of calm with you into the rest of your day. The peace that you've cultivated is always within you. You only need to pause, breathe, and tune in. <PAUSE: 5>

Meditation is not about silencing the mind, which is an impossible task. It's about witnessing the mind, becoming aware of its chatter but not getting lost in the story it tells. With practice, you will find more moments of peace and calm, more moments where you are fully present, fully here. <PAUSE: 10>

May your day be peaceful, may your heart be at ease. Until next time, my friend.
